metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12101 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An exploitable integer overflow exists in the'modifier_mdef_compact_influences' functionality of the Blender open-source3d creation suite v2.78c. A specially crafted .blend file can cause aninteger overflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for codeexecution under the context of the application. An attacker can convince auser to open a .blend file in order to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12101` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

blender - 2.79+dfsg0-1
blender-data - 2.79+dfsg0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: blender package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.79+dfsg0-1').
